title: Winter of Code 5.0 Inaugural Ceremony
description: The official kickoff of Winter of Code 5.0 - welcoming contributors to a GSoC-inspired open-source journey.
detailedDescription: The Inaugural Ceremony of Winter of Code 5.0 marks the official kickoff of a GSoC-inspired open-source program aimed at empowering students and developers to begin and grow their open-source journey. This session sets the vision, goals, and impact of WoC 5.0, introduces the community to the program structure, and features inspiring talks from renowned industry leaders and open-source advocates. With insights from global speakers, the ceremony is designed to ignite curiosity, motivation, and confidence in contributors as they step into the world of open source.
agenda: Welcome note and opening of Winter of Code 5.0
Introduction to Winter of Code and its GSoC-inspired vision
Program goals, structure, and timeline overview
Keynote and talks by industry leaders and open-source advocates
Insights and experiences from global open-source contributors
What participants can expect from WoC 5.0
Community values, collaboration, and code of conduct

title: Open Source 101
description: A practical introduction to open source, GSoC, and GitHub-straight from a GSoC 2025 mentor.
detailedDescription: Open Source 101 is a beginner-friendly yet insightful session designed to help students and developers take their first confident steps into open source. Led by Amaan Bhati, DevRel Engineer at Keploy and Google Summer of Code (GSoC) 2025 Mentor, this session will cover the fundamentals of open source contributions, how programs like GSoC work, effective proposal writing strategies, and essential Git & GitHub workflows. Whether youâ€™re just starting out or planning to apply for GSoC, this session will give you a clear roadmap and practical guidance from someone actively working in the ecosystem.
agenda: Introduction to Open Source and why it matters
Overview of Google Summer of Code (GSoC)
How to get started with open source contributions
Git & GitHub fundamentals (repositories, issues, pull requests)
Common beginner mistakes and best practices
Live Q&A with a DevRel Engineer and GSoC 2025 Mentor
